column4: I'm getting 'Access point invalid" and "access point not associated" errors when trying to connect to a wireless network with Ubuntu.
It works on other wifi networks, but there's one particular coffee shop it just won't work with.
what type of security is that network?
I'm not sure.  How do I check?
iwlist scanning should give you more information about available networks...
It says "Encryption key: On" but doesn't indicate WPA or WEP
ok. that usually means hex.
hex?
i mean wep
Hmm, OK.
My home router says that, but it's WPA.  But it has an extra "IE" section.
if the encryption is on, and it doesn't speicify wpa, then it usually means it is wep.
Makes sense
I manually entered the key with iwconfig key, but it's still not working.
Should I turn off NetworkManager first?
How do I know if I need s: or not at the beginning of the key?
not sure. sorry. the forum post should tell...
It doesn't.  :-(
It just says that you need s: if it's ASCII, but not if it's Hex.  How do I know...? The key I have is just numbers.
umm. try both... :|
Thanks, for some reason that worked.  I thought I'd done all of that before.  ;-P  Thanks again!
